main_definition: To indicate or hint at something, often without explicitly stating it; to propose an idea indirectly.

meanings_and_examples.example: Her nodding indicated that she agreed with the suggestion.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To put forward a thought, idea, or solution without direct assertion.
meanings_and_examples.example: His silence was suggesting that he did not approve of the plan.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Implying or hinting at an action to be taken without explicit instruction.
meanings_and_examples.example: When she said 'It might help if we cleaned up a bit,' she was suggesting tidying the room.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To propose something in a subtle manner, often as part of conversation or dialogue.
meanings_and_examples.example: The committee member was quietly suggesting an alternative approach during the meeting.
